intro: Ebenus maingayi, commonly known as the African rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pink or red flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hair. Ebenus maingayi is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, particularly in coastal areas.
